purpleculture_pinyin:
qiǎng
to fight over; to rush; to scramble; to grab; to rob; to snatch
бороться за; Торопить; карабкаться; Хватать; Грабить; урвать

qiāng
see 抢风
см. 抢 风
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 抢)
Pictophonetic: 倉 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Antonyms: 讓
purpleculture_examples:
搶救 [ qiǎng jiù ]: to rescue
搶險 [ qiǎng xiǎn ]: emergency (measures); to react to an emergency
搶劫 [ qiǎng jié ]: to rob; looting
搶佔 [ qiǎng zhàn ]: to seize (the strategic high ground)
搶先 [ qiǎng xiān ]: to rush (to do sth urgent); to try to be the first; to forestall
搶劫罪 [ qiāng jié zuì ]: robbery
搶風 [ qiāng fēng ]: a headwind; a contrary wind
搶風航行 [ qiāng fēng háng xíng ]: to tack against the wind (sailing)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 倉 [ cāng ] granary, barn; cabin, berth
heisig_chinese_memo: Security guards at the storehouse stop people from getting their little fingers on the storage items and robbing the place.
Ru_trainchinese:
qiǎng: (глаг) грабить, отнимать, захватывать; бороться за, соперничать; спешить, торопиться; сдирать, скоблить
qiāng: (глаг) двигаться в противоположном направлении, идти против; (книжн.) бить в, ударять
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hand (扌) in the storehouse (倉) plunders
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Security guards at the storehouse stop people from getting their little fingers on the storage items and robbing the place.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " hand " to " cang " sound. The original meaning is touch and collision. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Wei Ce IV": "The fury of the commoner is also free from the stubbornness, and the head grabs the land." "The head grabs the ground" means hitting the ground with the head. The whole sentence means the anger of the civilians, but it is barefoot and barefoot with the head hitting the ground. Just the ground. Another example is "Zhuangzi. "Xiaoyaoyou": "I decided to fly, grab the elm tree, but the time does not come, and I control the ground, so I want it to be ninety thousand miles south?" Will stop).

" Grab " means reverse and reverse direction. "Guang Yun. "Yang Yun": "Snatch, refuse." As the Eastern Jin Yu explained "Yangdu Fu": "Boats grab the wind, and the people are surviving waves." Northern Song Su Shunqin "South of the city is worth the big storm": "Look down to grab the new wind, both eyes I dare not open."

" Grab " also means chaos. "Ji Yun. "Geng Yun": "Snatch, rush, chaos." Such as "Han Shu. "Jia Yi Biography": "The back and the end are inconsistent, the first and the last are determined, the national system is arrogant, not very disciplined, Hu can be said to govern!" Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty "The original text of Diao Qu:"

" Snatch " means to fight, snatch, and then uprising. "Zhengzitong. Hand": "Grab, fight for it." Such as "Ming Law. Criminal Law. Thieves Robbery by Day": "Anyone who snatches people and property in the daytime has one hundred rods." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "Escape": "The family's bags were all snatched by the chaos."

" Grab " means to be the first to compete. For example, Chapter 16 of "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "I saw countless military horses at the front of the door, each with a long spear, rushing into the village." Chapter 12 of "The Romance of the Gods": "Nezha grabbed one step to catch up, and stepped on Ao Bing. Lifting the circle of heaven and earth, and hitting the door, knocking out the third prince’s body is like a dragon, standing upright on the ground.”

" Snatching " means robbing white, that is, sarcasm or denounce in person. Such as "The Tune of the West Chamber Zhugong. Volume Four: "Don’t blame me for robbing, don’t blame me, I’m doing this for a younger sister, then it’s worth teaching people to be a talent!" The second fold of Yuan Dynasty’s Bai Pu’s "Wall Touhou": "To scold him for stealing Cold and warm little slaves, want to rob him face to face like this." He also said that his words were blunt, such as Tang Xianzu's "Handan Ji." "Sheng 寤": "The old lady's words are too aggressive, and the old man is strong and respectful."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " to the " cang " sound. The original meaning is touch and collision, but later it means contention and snatch.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「倉」聲。本義是觸碰、碰撞。如《戰國策．魏策四》：「布衣之怒，亦免冠徒跣，以頭搶地爾。」「以頭搶地」即以頭撞地，全句意謂平民之怒，不過是脫帽赤足，以頭撞地而已。又如《莊子．逍遙遊》：「我決起而飛，搶榆枋，時則不至，而控於地而已矣，奚以之九萬里而南為？」「搶榆枋」即碰到榆樹、枋樹（就會停下來）。

　　「搶」表示逆、反方向。《廣韻．陽韻》：「搶，拒也。」如東晉庾闡〈揚都賦〉：「艇子搶風，榜人逸浪。」北宋蘇舜欽〈城南歸值大風雪〉：「低頭搶朔風，兩眼不敢開。」

　　「搶」也表示紛亂。《集韻．庚韻》：「搶，搶攘，亂皃。」如《漢書．賈誼傳》：「本末舛逆，首尾衡決，國制搶攘，非甚有紀，胡可謂治！」唐代柳宗元〈弔屈原文〉：「支離搶攘兮，遭世孔疚。」

　　「搶」表示爭奪、搶奪，乃後起義。《正字通．手部》：「搶，爭取也。」如《明律．刑律．賊盜白晝搶奪》：「凡白晝搶奪人財物者，杖一百。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．逃難》：「家眷行囊，俱被亂民搶去。」

　　「搶」表示爭先、搶先。如《三國演義》第16回：「只見門首無數軍馬，各挺長鎗，搶入寨來。」《封神演義》第12回：「哪吒搶一步趕上去，一腳踏住敖丙的頸項，提起乾坤圈，照頂門一下，把三太子的元身打出，是一條龍，在地上挺直。」

　　「搶」表示搶白，即當面諷指或指斥。如《西廂記諸宮調．卷四》：「莫怪我搶，休怪我責，我為個妹妹你作此態，便不枉了教人喚做秀才！」元代白樸《牆頭馬上》第二折：「枉駡他偷寒送暖小奴才，要這般當面搶白。」又表示言語生硬，如明代湯顯祖《邯鄲記．生寤》：「老夫人言詞太搶，老相公尊性兒厮強。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「倉」聲。本義是觸碰、碰撞，後來才表示爭奪、搶奪。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
搶 (Simplified: 抢)
Total strokes: 13; Radical: 手
Pictophonetic: 倉 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 倉 [ cāng ] granary, barn; cabin, berth
Antonyms: 讓
  • Pinyin: qiǎng

    English Definition: to fight over; to rush; to scramble; to grab; to rob; to snatch
    Example Words:
    搶救 [ qiǎng jiù ]: to rescue
    搶險 [ qiǎng xiǎn ]: emergency (measures); to react to an emergency
    搶劫 [ qiǎng jié ]: to rob; looting
    搶佔 [ qiǎng zhàn ]: to seize (the strategic high ground)
    搶先 [ qiǎng xiān ]: to rush (to do sth urgent); to try to be the first; to forestall
    More: 搶* | *搶 | *搶*
  • Pinyin: qiāng

    English Definition: see 抢风
    Example Words:
    搶劫罪 [ qiāng jié zuì ]: robbery
    搶風 [ qiāng fēng ]: a headwind; a contrary wind
    搶風航行 [ qiāng fēng háng xíng ]: to tack against the wind (sailing)
    More: 搶* | *搶 | *搶*

搶字的基本解释

搶
qiǎng

搶
qiāng

搶
chēng
均见“抢”。

搶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiāng］
［《廣韻》七羊切，平陽，清。］
［《廣韻》初兩切，上養，初。］
“抢1”的繁体字。
(1)撞；触；冲。
(2)推，搡。
(3)逆；顶；挡。
(4)创伤，伤。
(5)代替。参见“搶替”。
(6)书画技法术语。谓用笔由蹲而斜上急出。
[②]［qiǎng］
［《正字通》楚兩切］
“抢2”的繁体字。
(1)抢夺。
(2)赶；赶紧；抢先。
(3)抢白；言词生硬。
(4)刮掉或擦掉物体表层。
[③]［qiàng］
“抢3”的繁体字。
(1)同“鎗”。在器物上填嵌金银等饰物。参见“搶3金”。
(2)同“嗆”。因异物刺激气管引起气逆咳嗽。
[④]［chéng］
［《集韻》鋤庚切，平庚，崇。］
“抢4”的繁体字。
见“搶4攘”。
[⑤]［chēng］
［《玉篇》初庚切］
“抢5”的繁体字。
(1)见“攙搶”。
(2)美丽，漂亮。

搶字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　搶； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页448第22
【唐韻】【正韻】七兩切【集韻】【韻會】此兩切，?鏘上聲。突也。又爭取也。今律法有白晝搶奪。或作摤。又【唐韻】七羊切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】千羊切，?音鏘。拒也。亦突也。【戰國策】布衣之怒，亦以頭搶地耳。【前漢·揚雄·校獵賦】角搶題注。【註】搶，猶刺也。眾獸以角搶地。　又集也，飛掠也。【莊子·逍遙遊】決起而飛，搶榆枋。　又【唐韻】初兩切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】楚兩切，?倉上聲。亦突也。又著也。　又【集韻】鋤庚切，音傖。搶攘，亂貌。【前漢·賈誼傳】國制搶攘。　又千剛切，音倉。搶搪，鋸也。　又【韻會】楚耕切，音鎗。欃槍，或作攙搶。彗星也。【司馬相如·大人賦】㩜攙搶以爲旌。　又【字彙補】此亮切，鏘去聲。吳楚謂帆上風曰搶，今舟人曰掉搶。【庾闡·揚都賦】艇子搶風，榜人逸浪。

搶字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
搶字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
grab
qiǎng
grab
qiāng
grab
chēng

grab
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiāng］
["Guangyun" seven sheep cut, Pingyang, Qing. ]
["Guangyun" at the beginning of two cuts, upper raising, beginning. ]
"Grab 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Bump; touch; rush.
(2) Pushing, shoving.
(3) Inverse; top; block.
(4) Trauma, injury.
(5) Replace. See "Replacement".
(6) Terminology of calligraphy and painting techniques. Said that with the pen from squatting and slanting up and out quickly.
[②]［qiǎng］
["Zhengzitong" Chu Two Cuts]
"Grab 2" in traditional characters.
(1) Looting.
(2) Hurry; hurry; be the first.
(3) Grab the white; the words are blunt.

"Grab 3" in traditional characters.

(2) Same as "choking". A foreign body irritates the trachea and causes a gas-inverse cough.
